pageContext.surface: one side smooth.  the other slightly encrusted.
pageContext.other: 6-part, hand-drawn illustration with some dimensions.  3 parts appear to have been added later on top of white labels., First 3 lines of SITE information are written in different handwriting and ink over white-out label.
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT, followed by the notation in pencil:, Q I I 2, below this in ink:, July 1923
pageContext.collection: (In possession of Wandworth. Wimbledon, E. Dist Gas Co), British Museum, 1928.  1-20. 1
pageContext.site: GREATER LONDON,  Wandsworth,  Gas Works, works of the Wandsworth. Wimbledon & Epsom Dist. gas Co., 150 yds south of Thames. formerly known as Church Walk & Harple Road., 6 feet from present. 2 feet from original surface., 11 April 1923.
pageContext.remarks: LOWER LEFT CORNER:, Rather inacc., LOWER RIGHT CORNER:, C 1  [in pencil]
